1.text: Create a steaming solution with water and citrus or vinegar.

2.text: Add 1 tablespoon (14 g) of baking soda to the solution if your microwave smells.

3.text: Put a wooden skewer into the bowl.

4.text: Microwave the solution on "high" for 5 minutes.

5.text: Wait 5 minutes to open the microwave so the steam can loosen grime.

6.text: Remove the solution and turntable before washing it with soapy water.

7.text: Scrub the bottom, sides, top, and door of the interior with a sponge or cloth.

8.text: Wipe the inside of the microwave with a dry cloth.

9.text: Put the turntable back into the microwave.

10.text: Rub away grease stains using a baking soda paste.

11.text: Wipe away yellow stains with nail polish remover.

12.text: Scrub scorch marks with a sponge soaked with vinegar and baking soda.

13.text: Dip a cloth into soapy water and wring it out.

14.text: Use the cloth to wipe the top, sides, and display panel.

15.text: Wipe a clean damp cloth over the microwave to rinse off the soap.

16.text: Use commercial disinfectant if your microwave is very dirty.

17.text: Rub a dry cloth over the microwave to remove moisture.
